title: Tuskegee's Hilani Cantone Selected for HBCU All-Star Game in San Antonio - BVM Sports
text:
Tuskegeeâ€™s Hilani Cantone Selected for HBCU All-Star Game in San Antonio
Tuskegee University women's basketball player Hilani Cantone has been selected for the 2025 HBCU All-Star Game, marking a historic first for a women's edition of the event. Scheduled for April 6, 2025, in San Antonio, Texas, this annual game showcases top athletes from HBCUs across the nation. Cantone has been a standout performer for the Golden Tigers, averaging 12.2 points and playing a crucial role in her team's 20-10 season. Her contributions have earned her All-SIAC First Team and All-Tournament Team honors this postseason. The game, designed to celebrate HBCU excellence, will be broadcasted nationally, offering significant exposure for Cantone and her peers.
- Cantone averages 12.2 points per game, along with 4.7 rebounds, 2.1 assists, and 1.6 steals.
- She started in 29 out of 30 games during the season, contributing to a 20-10 overall record for the Golden Tigers.
- Cantone's selection highlights her individual achievements in a competitive HBCU basketball landscape.
- The HBCU All-Star Game aims to uplift and celebrate the talent within Black college athletics.
The HBCU All-Star Game is set to elevate the profiles of its participating athletes, including Cantone, potentially opening doors for future opportunities in basketball and beyond. Fans can look forward to a high-stakes competition showcasing exceptional talent.
Bottom LineCantone's inclusion in the HBCU All-Star Game underscores the significance of representation and showcases the incredible talent present in historically Black colleges and universities. This event not only celebrates athletic prowess but also contributes to the broader recognition of HBCU achievements.
